The 'Whitey' Bulger trial

Jury receives the 'Whitey' Bulger case

After 35 days of a trial that included grotesque stories of underworld brutality and betrayal, a jury of eight men and four women began deliberations today in the federal racketeering trial of FBI informant and crime boss James “Whitey” Bulger, who is accused of participating in 19 murders. (12:41 p.m.)
  • 12 explosive trial moments  |  PDF Jury's Bulger verdict slip  |  Live Blog  |  More on the trial

Stop & Shop closing its New Hampshire stores

The company that owns the Stop & Shop supermarket chain said the stores have not achieved performance goals. (1:17 p.m.)

Dad of bomb suspect's friend wants to sue FBI

The father of Ibragim Todashev, who was shot and killed by an FBI agent in Florida, said he is seeking a civil suit against the FBI for his son’s death. (1:45 p.m.)

Divers back at lake in Aaron Hernandez case

Police divers resumed searching a Bristol, Conn., lake for the gun used in the murder of Odin Lloyd. (1:34 p.m.)

We asked readers what it is that makes us....well, us. Here are your answers, including this one, from Jay in Derry, N.H.: "You remember when there were amusements and rides at Revere Beach."

Business & Money

Children's Place drops T-shirt that suggests girls can't do math

The girls’ shirts said ‘‘My best subjects’’ at the top and had checks in boxes next to shopping, music, and dancing. The box next to math was blank. Under, it said, ‘‘Well, nobody’s perfect.’’
